Package ohos.agp.window.service

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.service.Display

  • public class Display
extends Object
    Encapsulates display attributes and operations.

    An Display object is returned by DisplayManager.getDefaultDisplay(Context).

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayId

        public int getDisplayId​()
        Obtains the ID of a display.
        Returns:
        Returns the display ID.

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName​()
        Obtains the name of a display.
        Returns:
        Returns the display name.

      • getRotation

        public int getRotation​()
        Obtains the rotation degree of a display. The rotation degree is represented by an enumeration value. 0 indicates no rotation, 1 indicates 90 degrees, 2 indicates 180 degrees, and 3 indicates 270 degrees.
        Returns:
        Returns the rotation degree of the display.

      • getAttributes

        public DisplayAttributes getAttributes​()
        Obtains the Attributes of a display. The width and height of the navigation bar are excluded.
        Returns:
        Returns the Attributes of the display.

      • getRealAttributes

        public DisplayAttributes getRealAttributes​()
        Obtains the actual Attributes of a display.
        Returns:
        Returns the actual Attributes of the display.

      • getCurrentSizeRange

        public void getCurrentSizeRange​(Point outSmallestSize,
                                Point outLargestSize)
        Obtains the size range of a display, in unit of pixels.

        This method obtains the maximum and minimum sizes of the display expected in all directions. The obtained display range is stored in the parameters of this method.

        Parameters:
        outSmallestSize - Indicates the minimum display size.
        outLargestSize - Indicates the maximum display size.

      • getSize

        public void getSize​(Point outSize)
        Obtains the size of a display.

        This method may not return the actual size of the display. For example, the returned value has excluded the size of the status bar if status bar is always displayed, or the value matches a display that has been scaled for adapting to a small-screen device.

        Parameters:
        outSize - Indicates the display size.

      • getRealSize

        public void getRealSize​(Point outSize)
        Obtains the actual display size.

        The returned value includes the size of the status bar, without any scale.

        Parameters:
        outSize - Indicates the actual size of the display.
